entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:32AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... Conditions remain dry across Southeast Alaska and temperatures will rise once again as high as the mid 80s in some places today. Relative humidity values will fall into the lows 20s or even the mid teens with daytime peak heating. Fine fuels are dry and there is a risk of camp fires getting out of control. Winds will remain
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

James River near Forestburg affecting Sanborn County. James River at Huron affecting Beadle County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 9:32AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Texas, including the following county, Wichita. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 8:49AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Texas, including the following county, Baylor. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 02 at 2:04PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ozone Action Day... The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has issued an Ozone Action Day for the Houston, Galveston, and Brazoria area for Friday, June 3, 2022. Atmospheric conditions are expected to be favorable for producing high levels of ozone pollution in the Houston, Galveston, and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Coastal Harris; Galveston Island; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Harris

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 03 at 5:08AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH SUNDAY WITH A RISK OF HEAVY RAIN AND LOCALIZED FLOODING... Periods of moderate to heavy rain associated with showers and thunderstorms will continue through Sunday over portions of central and eastern Washington and eastern Oregon. Several rounds of showers and thunderstorms over the coming days may yield up to 0.5 inches to
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Northwest Blue Mountains

entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 03 at 3:08AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH 10 PM THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Washington, including the following counties, Asotin and Garfield.
